data.Element: Pregnancy, breast‑feeding and fertility
data.Text: Pregnancy, breast‑feeding and fertility

data.Element: You and your partner must use two methods of effective contraception during your treatment with this medicine. Women must continue using contraception for 6 months following the last dose of Adcetris.
data.Text: You and your partner must use two methods of effective contraception during your treatment with this medicine. Women must continue using contraception for 6 months following the last dose of Adcetris.

data.Element: You should not use this medicine if you are pregnant unless you and your doctor decide that the benefit to you outweighs the potential risk to the unborn baby.
data.Text: You should not use this medicine if you are pregnant unless you and your doctor decide that the benefit to you outweighs the potential risk to the unborn baby.

data.Element: It is important to tell your doctor before and during treatment if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant, or are planning to get pregnant.
data.Text: It is important to tell your doctor before and during treatment if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant, or are planning to get pregnant.

data.Element: If you are breast‑feeding, you should discuss with your doctor whether you should receive this medicine.
data.Text: If you are breast‑feeding, you should discuss with your doctor whether you should receive this medicine.

data.Element: Men being treated with this medicine are advised to have sperm samples frozen and stored before treatment. Men are advised not to father a child during treatment with this medicine and for up to 6 months following the last dose of this medicine.
data.Text: Men being treated with this medicine are advised to have sperm samples frozen and stored before treatment. Men are advised not to father a child during treatment with this medicine and for up to 6 months following the last dose of this medicine.

data.Element: Your treatment may influence your ability to drive or operate machines. If you feel unwell during treatment then do not drive or operate machines.

Adcetris contains sodium

data.Element: This medicine contains 13.2 mg sodium (main component of cooking/table salt) in each vial. This is equivalent to 0.7% of the recommended maximum daily dietary intake of sodium for an adult.

data.Element: 3. How Adcetris will be given

data.Element: If you have any questions on the use of this medicine, ask the doctor or nurse who is giving you the infusion.
data.Text: If you have any questions on the use of this medicine, ask the doctor or nurse who is giving you the infusion.
Dose and frequency

data.Element: The dose of this medicine depends on your body weight.
data.Text: The dose of this medicine depends on your body weight.

data.Element: ·The usual dose of Adcetris given in combination with doxorubicin, vinblastine and dacarbazine is 1.2 mg/kg given every 2 weeks for 6 months.
data.Text: ·The usual dose of Adcetris given in combination with doxorubicin, vinblastine and dacarbazine is 1.2 mg/kg given every 2 weeks for 6 months.

data.Element: ·The usual dose of Adcetris given in combination with cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin and prednisone is 1.8 mg/kg given every 3 weeks for approximately 4‑6 months.
data.Text: ·The usual dose of Adcetris given in combination with cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin and prednisone is 1.8 mg/kg given every 3 weeks for approximately 4‑6 months.

data.Element: See the package leaflets for these medicines given in combination with Adcetris for additional information on their use and effects. After the first dose of Adcetris in combination with chemotherapy, your doctor may also give you a medicine that will help prevent development or reduce the severity of neutropenia (decrease of white blood cell count) which can increase the risk of infection. Tell your doctor if you have kidney or liver problems as your doctor may lower your starting dose or may not recommend Adcetris.
data.Text: See the package leaflets for these medicines given in combination with Adcetris for additional information on their use and effects. After the first dose of Adcetris in combination with chemotherapy, your doctor may also give you a medicine that will help prevent development or reduce the severity of neutropenia (decrease of white blood cell count) which can increase the risk of infection. Tell your doctor if you have kidney or liver problems as your doctor may lower your starting dose or may not recommend Adcetris.

data.Element: ·The usual dose of Adcetris given alone is 1.8 mg/kg, given once every 3 weeks for no more than one year. Your doctor may lower your starting dose to 1.2 mg/kg if you have kidney or liver problems.
data.Text: ·The usual dose of Adcetris given alone is 1.8 mg/kg, given once every 3 weeks for no more than one year. Your doctor may lower your starting dose to 1.2 mg/kg if you have kidney or liver problems.

data.Element: Adcetris is to be given to adults only. It is not for use in children.

data.Text: How Adcetris is given

data.Element: This medicine is given to you into a vein (intravenously) as an infusion. It is given by your doctor or nurse over 30 minutes. Your doctor or nurse will also monitor you during and after the infusion.
data.Text: This medicine is given to you into a vein (intravenously) as an infusion. It is given by your doctor or nurse over 30 minutes. Your doctor or nurse will also monitor you during and after the infusion.

Infusion reactions

data.Element: Medicines of this type (monoclonal antibodies) can cause infusion reactions such as:

-a rash

-difficulty breathing
-cough

data.Element: -a tight chest
data.Text: -a tight chest
-fever

-chills

data.Element: Infusion reactions to this medicine may affect more than 1 in 10 people.
data.Text: Infusion reactions to this medicine may affect more than 1 in 10 people.

data.Element: In general, these types of reactions occur within minutes to several hours following completion of the infusion. However, they may develop more than several hours after completion of the infusion but this is uncommon. These infusion reactions can be serious or even fatal (known as an anaphylactic reaction). It is not known how frequently infusion-related reactions to this medicine are serious or fatal.

It is not known how frequently infusion-related reactions to this medicine are serious or fatal.

data.Element: Reporting of side effects

data.Element: If you get any side effects, talk to your doctor. This includes any possible side effects not listed in this leaflet. You can also report side effects directly via the national reporting system listed in Appendix V. By reporting side effects you can help provide more information on the safety of this medicine.

data.Element: 5. How to store Adcetris
data.Text: 5.       How to store Adcetris

data.Element: Keep this medicine out of the sight and reach of children.
data.Text: Keep this medicine out of the sight and reach of children.

data.Element: Do not use this medicine after the expiry date which is stated on the vial label and the carton after EXP. The expiry date refers to the last day of that month.
data.Text: Do not use this medicine after the expiry date which is stated on the vial label and the carton after EXP. The expiry date refers to the last day of that month.

data.Element: Unopened vial: Store in a refrigerator (2 °C‑8 °C). Do not freeze.
data.Text: Unopened vial: Store in a refrigerator (2 °C‑8 °C). Do not freeze.

data.Element: Keep the vial in the original carton in order to protect from light.
data.Text: Keep the vial in the original carton in order to protect from light.

data.Element: Reconstituted/diluted solution:Use immediately or store in a refrigerator (2 °C‑8 °C) and use within 24 hours.
data.Text: Reconstituted/diluted solution:Use immediately or store in a refrigerator (2 °C‑8 °C) and use within 24 hours.

data.Element: Do not use this medicine if you notice any particulate matter or discolouration prior to administration.
data.Text: Do not use this medicine if you notice any particulate matter or discolouration prior to administration.

data.Element: Do not throw away any medicines via wastewater or household waste. The doctor or nurse will dispose of this medicine. These measures will help protect the environment.
data.Text: Do not throw away any medicines via wastewater or household waste. The doctor or nurse will dispose of this medicine. These measures will help protect the environment.

data.Element: 6. Contents of the pack and other information
data.Text: 6.       Contents of the pack and other information
What Adcetris contains

data.Element: -The active substance is brentuximab vedotin. Each vial contains 50 mg of brentuximab vedotin. After reconstitution each mL of solution contains 5 mg of Adcetris.
data.Text: -The active substance is brentuximab vedotin. Each vial contains 50 mg of brentuximab vedotin. After reconstitution each mL of solution contains 5 mg of Adcetris.

data.Element: -The other ingredients are citric acid monohydrate, sodium citrate dihydrate, α,α‑trehalose dihydrate, and polysorbate 80 See section 2 for further information about sodium.
data.Text: -The other ingredients are citric acid monohydrate, sodium citrate dihydrate, α,α‑trehalose dihydrate, and polysorbate 80 See section 2 for further information about sodium.

data.Element: What Adcetris looks like and contents of the pack
data.Text: What Adcetris looks like and contents of the pack

data.Element: Adcetris is a white to off-white cake or powder for concentrate for solution for infusion provided in a glass vial.
data.Text: Adcetris is a white to off-white cake or powder for concentrate for solution for infusion provided in a glass vial.

data.Element: Each pack of Adcetris consists of one vial.
data.Text: Each pack of Adcetris consists of one vial.

data.Element: The following information is intended for healthcare professionals only:
data.Text: The following information is intended for healthcare professionals only:
Traceability

data.Element: In order to improve the traceability of biological medicinal products, the name and the batch number of the administered product should be clearly recorded.
data.Text: In order to improve the traceability of biological medicinal products, the name and the batch number of the administered product should be clearly recorded.
Disposal

data.Element: Adcetris is for single use only.
data.Text: Adcetris is for single use only.

data.Element: Any unused product or waste material should be disposed of in accordance with local requirements.
data.Text: Any unused product or waste material should be disposed of in accordance with local requirements.
Instructions for reconstitution

data.Element: Each single use vial must be reconstituted with 10.5 mL of water for injections to a final concentration of 5 mg/mL. Each vial contains a 10% overfill giving 55 mg of Adcetris per vial and a total reconstituted volume of 11 mL.
data.Text: Each single use vial must be reconstituted with 10.5 mL of water for injections to a final concentration of 5 mg/mL. Each vial contains a 10% overfill giving 55 mg of Adcetris per vial and a total reconstituted volume of 11 mL.

data.Element: 1.Direct the stream toward the wall of the vial and not directly at the cake or powder.
data.Text: 1.Direct the stream toward the wall of the vial and not directly at the cake or powder.

data.Element: 2.Gently swirl the vial to aid dissolution. DO NOT SHAKE.
data.Text: 2.Gently swirl the vial to aid dissolution. DO NOT SHAKE.

data.Element: 3.The reconstituted solution in the vial is a clear to slightly opalescent, colourless solution with a final pH of 6.6.
data.Text: 3.The reconstituted solution in the vial is a clear to slightly opalescent, colourless solution with a final pH of 6.6.

data.Element: 4.The reconstituted solution should be inspected visually for any foreign particulate matter and/or discolouration. In the event of either being observed, discard the medicinal product.
data.Text: 4.The reconstituted solution should be inspected visually for any foreign particulate matter and/or discolouration. In the event of either being observed, discard the medicinal product.

data.Element: Preparation of Infusion Solution
data.Text: Preparation of Infusion Solution

data.Element: The appropriate amount of reconstituted Adcetris must be withdrawn from the vial(s) and added to an infusion bag containing sodium chloride 9 mg/mL (0.9%) solution for injection in order to achieve a final concentration of 0.4‑1.2 mg/mL Adcetris. The recommended diluent volume is 150 mL. The already reconstituted Adcetris can also be diluted into 5% dextrose for injection or Lactated Ringer's for injection.
data.Text: The appropriate amount of reconstituted Adcetris must be withdrawn from the vial(s) and added to an infusion bag containing sodium chloride 9 mg/mL (0.9%) solution for injection in order to achieve a final concentration of 0.4‑1.2 mg/mL Adcetris. The recommended diluent volume is 150 mL. The already reconstituted Adcetris can also be diluted into 5% dextrose for injection or Lactated Ringer's for injection.

data.Element: Gently invert the bag to mix the solution containing Adcetris. DO NOT SHAKE.
data.Text: Gently invert the bag to mix the solution containing Adcetris. DO NOT SHAKE.

data.Element: Any portion left in the vial, after withdrawal of the volume to be diluted, must be disposed of in accordance with local requirements.
data.Text: Any portion left in the vial, after withdrawal of the volume to be diluted, must be disposed of in accordance with local requirements.

data.Element: Do not add other medicinal products to the prepared Adcetris infusion solution or intravenous infusion set. The infusion line should be flushed following administration with sodium chloride 9 mg/mL (0.9%) solution for injection, 5% dextrose for injection, or Lactated Ringer's for injection.
data.Text: Do not add other medicinal products to the prepared Adcetris infusion solution or intravenous infusion set. The infusion line should be flushed following administration with sodium chloride 9 mg/mL (0.9%) solution for injection, 5% dextrose for injection, or Lactated Ringer's for injection.

data.Element: Following dilution, infuse the Adcetris solution immediately at the recommended infusion rate.
data.Text: Following dilution, infuse the Adcetris solution immediately at the recommended infusion rate.

data.Element: Total storage time of the solution from reconstitution to infusion should not exceed 24 hours.
data.Text: Total storage time of the solution from reconstitution to infusion should not exceed 24 hours.
